Bride-to-be vanishes in N.Y. boat crash

Authorities pulled a female body from the Hudson River on Saturday near where a bride-to-be and her fiance's best man were thrown into the water when a speedboat carrying six friends crashed into a construction barge near the Tappan Zee Bridge. (2:06 p.m.)

Dozens killed in Egypt

Clashes erupted today in Cairo between security forces and supporters of Egypt's ousted President Mohammed Morsi, killing at least 38 protesters and wounding others. (1:03 p.m.)

Skeptics and conspiracy theorists from around the world have coalesced on social media.

Review: Taylor Swift delivers spectacle with shaky vocals

Credit Swift for canny hookcraft: If there’s anything that can cover up a singer’s vocal flaws, real or perceived, it’s 50,000 people singing along to “We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together.”
Opinion | Kevin Cullen

Dispelling 'Whitey' myths

Whitey Bulger’s defiance during his arrest in Santa Monica wasn’t some invitation to suicide-by-cop. He just didn’t want to stain his white Chinos.

A pontiff of surprises

Since his March election, Pope Francis has insisted on an informal, populist approach to the papacy, with a special concern for the poor and downtrodden.
Opinion | Christopher L. Gasper

As the Patriots remodel their passing game without Wes Welker or Aaron Hernandez, Stevan Ridley should have a bigger role this season.

Grammy-winning musician JJ Cale dies; wrote Clapton, Skynyrd hits
